21:07 • 9 days ago

Simon Willison

Quoting Tom MacWright

Building technology in startups is all about having the right level of tech debt. If you have none, you‚Äôre probably going too slow and not prioritizing product-market fit and the important business stuff. If you get too much, everything grinds to a halt. Plus, tech debt is a ‚Äúknow it when you see it‚Äù kind of thing, and I know that my definition of ‚Äúa bunch of tech debt‚Äù is, to other people, ‚Äúvery

Building technology in startups is all about having the right level of tech debt. If you have none, you‚Äôre probably going too slow and not prioritizing product-market fit and the important business stuff. If you get too much, everything grinds to a halt. Plus, tech debt is a ‚Äúknow it when you see it‚Äù kind of thing, and I know that my definition of ‚Äúa bunch of tech debt‚Äù is, to other people, ‚Äúvery little tech debt.‚Äù

‚Äî Tom MacWright

Tags: technical-debt, tom-macwright

16:36 • 10 days ago

Wrench in the Gears

Cheri Honkala, Philadelphia Housing Rights Activist, Aligns With Blockchain Game To Train Benevolent AI And Catalyze A Digital World Constitution

Below is a summary of my most recent post from Hot Springs, Arkansas. It just goes to show how fragile our perceived ‚Äúreality‚Äù is in a world increasingly governed by the physics of information. It truly is a fascinating time to be alive. With digital media working overtime to keep everyone in their assigned ‚Äúreality [...]

Below is a summary of my most recent post from Hot Springs, Arkansas. It just goes to show how fragile our perceived ‚Äúreality‚Äù is in a world increasingly governed by the physics of information. It truly is a fascinating time to be alive.

With digital media working overtime to keep everyone in their assigned ‚Äúreality tunnels‚Äù it may be hard to contemplate new wrinkles to the story that are so bizarre as to appear over-the-top spectacle. And yet, Elowyn, a blockchain Decentralized Autonomous Organization, with bottom-up game mechanics and in-game token economy linked to ‚Äúpeace,‚Äù ‚Äúhealing,‚Äù and ‚Äúsustainability‚Äù has been designed with financial support from Ben Goertzel (the creator of Sophia the robot‚Äôs brain) and Michaela Ulieru (Singularity.net‚Äôs Chief Alchemist) to generate psychological data that will supposedly train ‚Äúbenevolent AI.‚Äù

Download White Paper Here: https://docsend.com/view/zfiqunqgxm98tbt4 Source: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BUy1YcYAzcA The leader of the Elowyn initiative, Anneloes Smitsman, based on the tiny volcanic island of Mauritius in the Indian Ocean, has also been involved with educational programs in partnership with systems theorist Alexander Laszlo and Russian transhumanist Pavel Luksha. Both are affiliated with Global Education Futures that has footprints, through Tom Vander Ark‚Äôs former ed-tech investment fund Learn Capital, on Powder Mountain, Utah and in Arena Hall in Austin, Texas. Source: https://wrenchinthegears.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/11/EvolutionaryLearningEcosystemsforThrivableFuturesCraftingandCuratingtheConditionsforFutureFitEducation.pdf Source: https://x.com/SingularityNET/status/1763227101426061353 The backer of Smitsman‚Äôs education initiative, piloted in several Catholic schools on the island, was backed by Investec, an Australian bank that is deeply involved in human capital bets on children. Smitsman has conducted research in South Africa and Australia, and both countries are hotbeds of blockchain impact finance. One of the advisors to Smitsman‚Äôs ‚ÄúEarthwise‚Äù organization and promoter of the archetypal card game to ‚Äúfight Moloch‚Äù is Laura George, ordained priest of the interfaith order of Melchizedeck, human potential movement advocate, and leader of the ‚ÄúPeace Pentagon‚Äù situated along the ancient New River in the mountains of Virginia. Laura George and Glen Martin, philosophy professor at Radford College, are working to develop a worldwide constitution in coordination with Smitsman‚Äôs benevolent AGI program through the Peace Pentagon‚Äôs umbrella organization ‚ÄúThe Oracle Institute.‚Äù Source: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tJj2RMceK_8 Source: https://www.grapevine.org/giving-circle/bpWhMbq/Oracle-Institute-EARTHwise-Centre-Global-Initiatives Source: https://earthconstitution.world/glen-martin/ Source: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pb5lypcN5jU Source: https://medium.com/singularitynet/governing-the-ungovernable-crafting-a-global-constitution-for-agi-b7485e44948f Imagine my shock that when pulling this thread I find Philadelphia housing rights activist, Cheri Honkala, listed as an advisor to George‚Äôs Institute. Cheri‚Äôs photo is featured in the same row as Anneloes Smitsman. When I contacted Cheri with documentation of the Elowyn DAO and the planned AGI world constitution, the only response I received was a brief text thanking me for the information. When I requested a follow up, so that I could accurately represent Cheri and the Poor People‚Äôs Economic Human Rights Campaign‚Äôs relationship to this effort I received no further response, which leaves me presuming tacit endorsement. Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20240804195108/https://www.theoracleinstitute.org/team Source: https://www.facebook.com/PeacePentagon/videos/vlog-14-cheri-honkala-and-the-woman-warrior-retreat/622965811518184/?locale=ms_MY&_rdr Source: https://www.facebook.com/OracleInstitute/posts/donate-now-httpsmightycausecomstorypeace-pentagon-skylightbarbara-marx-hubbard-v/10155598112917395/ Source: https://peacepentagon.net/about-our-community The beginning of this video also discusses author Robert Anton Wilson‚Äôs ideas, in partnership with Timothy Leary‚Äôs research on Eight Circuits of Consciousness, about ‚Äúreality tunnels.‚Äù Reality Tunnels are the stories we live inside to make sense of the world. I personally am not comfortable with a reality tunnel where housing insecure people are sponsored by impact investors to acquire crypto card decks to fight Moloch, bend time, and train Sophia the Robot on blockchain while being subjected to behavioral hazing, but I suppose to some that model may seem appropriate. It certainly wasn‚Äôt what I signed up for when I worked with PPEHRC in Philadelphia to try and raise awareness about digital twins, blockchain, social impact finance and cybernetics. Source: https://wrenchinthegears.com/2019/10/20/pay-for-success-the-opioid-crisis-poor-peoples-economic-human-rights-campaign-radical-social-work-breakfast-presentation/ Jason Bosch also had close connections to Cheri and PPEHRC for many years. In fact that is how he connected with me after seeing a poor quality video I had made on my research topics during a PPEHRC-sponsored presentation at the Wooden Shoe bookstore in the spring of 2019. Throughout the lock downs Jason attempted to set up a conversation with Cheri Honkala about our findings on Web3 and our concerns about how the planned digital governance layer would impact poor communities and vulnerable populations. He was never able to pin Cheri down for a time to talk about it privately or on video. Source: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wQuOAMXyODs Looking back on my past experiences, I am having a very difficult time making sense of this development. I think most people lead their lives trying to have agency and make the world a better place. Does Cheri truly believe in gamified ‚Äúbenevolent AI‚Äù psychological profiling and a planned world constitution for universal ‚Äúpeace‚Äù even when it is clear that all of the players are aligned with the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (the structure for cybernetic systems engineering of people and populations into recursive fitness landscapes to improve their human potential)? At this point I can only guess, because communication channels are jammed. Source: https://docsend.com/view/zfiqunqgxm98tbt4 As the events of this week unfold, remember there are many things happening in the background that won‚Äôt make it into the main current of the media feeds for years to come. Nonetheless it may very well be those things are are most important to comprehend as we navigate the unbelievable developments that are unfolding. At the end of the day was it just one big Live-Action-Role-Play performance art piece? I close scratching my head and thinking again about the inversions in the plot of John Fowles‚Äô 1965, ‚ÄúThe Magus.‚Äù  Source: https://wrenchinthegears.com/2019/06/26/pay-for-success-finance-preys-upon-the-poor-presentation-at-left-forum-6-29-19/ Addendum: After I published this post, which I sent directly to Cheri and the associate mentioned in the video, she texted me back to say that she was no longer involved with The Oracle Institute. I had hoped that she would have conveyed that information to me when I contacted her twice  last week to ask for clarification in advance of sharing this research publicly. It was not my intent to skewer Cheri or PPEHRC, but this project is too important to simply be set aside as something to be considered on another day, especially for people ostensibly organizing vulnerable populations at a grassroots level. I wrote back to Cheri stating that I would be very interested in reading her take, or listening to a video of hers, on Laura George‚Äôs organization now that she has the larger context related to Smitsman, Earthwise, and Elowyn. The Oracle Institute‚Äôs ‚ÄúPeace Pentagon‚Äù identifies as an eco-village, a concept with tentacles going back to Findhorn in the UK and the origins of the New Age movement. Cheri was Jill Stein‚Äôs VP running mate on the Green Party ticket in the 2012 presidential race. When I was associated with PPEHRC we drove to Chicago and attended a day-long event hosted by the eco-socialist contingent of the Green Party, including Kali Akuno of Cooperation Jackson (a non-profit that has a Fab-Lab funded by MIT) and David Cobb who is involved with Cooperation Humboldt‚Äôs solidarity economy. I personally would be interested in hearing more from Cheri or other Green Party affiliates about how the Smitsman, Ulieru, Goertzel plan to use crypto gaming to train ‚Äúbenevolent AI‚Äù may intersect (or not) with the party‚Äôs platform around cooperatives, the environment, and ‚Äúpeace.‚Äù  Source: https://www.gp.org/the_four_pillars

 

Source: https://www.gp.org/building_the_movement_for_eco_socialism Source: https://www.gp.org/kali_akuno_2021_gp_keynote

Simon Willison

California Clock Change

California Clock Change The clocks go back in California tonight and I finally built my dream application for helping me remember if I get an hour extra of sleep or not, using a Claude Artifact. Here's the transcript. This is one of my favorite examples yet of the kind of tiny low stakes utilities I'm building with Claude Artifacts because the friction involved in churning out a working appl

California Clock Change

The clocks go back in California tonight and I finally built my dream application for helping me remember if I get an hour extra of sleep or not, using a Claude Artifact. Here's the transcript.

This is one of my favorite examples yet of the kind of tiny low stakes utilities I'm building with Claude Artifacts because the friction involved in churning out a working application has dropped almost to zero.

(I added another feature: it now includes a note of what time my Dog thinks it is if the clocks have recently changed.)

Tags: claude-artifacts, ai-assisted-programming, projects, ai, timezones, llms

05:11 • 10 days ago

Docling

Docling MIT licensed document extraction Python library from the Deep Search team at IBM, who released Docling v2 on October 16th. Here's the Docling Technical Report paper from August, which provides details of two custom models: a layout analysis model for figuring out the structure of the document (sections, figures, text, tables etc) and a TableFormer model specifically for extracting struc

Docling

MIT licensed document extraction Python library from the Deep Search team at IBM, who released Docling v2 on October 16th.

Here's the Docling Technical Report paper from August, which provides details of two custom models: a layout analysis model for figuring out the structure of the document (sections, figures, text, tables etc) and a TableFormer model specifically for extracting structured data from tables.

Those models are available on Hugging Face.

Here's how to try out the Docling CLI interface using uvx (avoiding the need to install it first - though since it downloads models it will take a while to run the first time):

uvx docling mydoc.pdf --to json --to md

This will output a mydoc.json file with complex layout information and a mydoc.md Markdown file which includes Markdown tables where appropriate.

The Python API is a lot more comprehensive. It can even extract tables as Pandas DataFrames:

from docling.document_converter import DocumentConverter converter = DocumentConverter() result = converter.convert("document.pdf") for table in result.document.tables: df = table.export_to_dataframe() print(df)

I ran that inside uv run --with docling python. It took a little while to run, but it demonstrated that the library works.

Tags: ocr, ai, pdf, python, ibm, hugging-face, uv

04:57 • 10 days ago

Ben Werdm√ºller

Election Issues 2024: Economy, Immigration, Abortion and More

[ProPublica] "With just days to go before Election Day, political coverage is everywhere. At ProPublica, we avoid horse race reporting and focus on telling stories about deeper issues and trends affecting the country. Here are some stories from the last year about issues that are important to voters." Some selected stories from my colleagues at ProPublica. #Democracy

Here are some stories from the last year about issues that are important to voters."

Some selected stories from my colleagues at ProPublica.

Saturday, 02. November 2024

IdM Laboratory

Okta AD/LDAP DelAuth„É¢„Ç∏„É•„Éº„É´„Å´Èñ¢„Åô„ÇãËÑÜÂº±ÊÄß

„Åì„Çì„Å´„Å°„ÅØ„ÄÅÂØåÂ£´Ê¶Æ„Åß„Åô„ÄÇ OktaÁ§æ„Çà„ÇäAD/LDAP DelAuth„É¢„Ç∏„É•„Éº„É´„Å´Èñ¢„Åô„ÇãËÑÜÂº±ÊÄß„ÅåÂ†±Âëä„Åï„Çå„Å¶„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åô„Å≠„ÄÇ https://trust.okta.com/security-advisories/okta-ad-ldap-delegated-authentication-username/ Â†±Âëä„Åï„Çå„Å¶„ÅÑ„ÇãÂÜÖÂÆπ„Å®„Åó„Å¶„ÅØ„ÄÅAD/LDAP DelAuth„É¢„Ç∏„É•„Éº„É´„Çí‰Ωø„Å£„Å¶„ÅÑ„ÇãÁí∞Â¢É„Åß„ÄÅÈÅéÂéª„Å´„Ç≠„É£„ÉÉ„Ç∑„É•„É≠„Ç∞„Ç§„É≥„Å´ÊàêÂäü„Åó„Åü„Åì„Å®„ÅÆ„ÅÇ„ÇãÂ†¥Âêà„ÄÅ„É¶„Éº„Ç∂„ÉºÂêç„Åå52ÊñáÂ≠ó‰ª•‰∏ä„Å†„Å®„Éë„Çπ„ÉØ„Éº„Éâ„Å™„ÅóÔºà„Ç≠„É£„ÉÉ„Ç∑„É•„ÅÆ„Åø„ÅßÔºâ„É≠„Ç∞„Ç§„É≥„ÅåÊàêÂäü„Åó„Å¶„Åó„Åæ„ÅÜ„ÄÅ„Å®„ÅÑ„ÅÜË©±„Åß„Åô„ÄÇ „Åì„Å°„Çâ‰∏äË®ò„ÅÆ„Çµ„Ç§„Éà„Åã„Çâ„ÅÆÂºïÁî®„Åß„Åô„ÄÇ On October 30, 2024, a vulnerability was internally identified in generating the cache key for AD/LDA

„Åì„Çì„Å´„Å°„ÅØ„ÄÅÂØåÂ£´Ê¶Æ„Åß„Åô„ÄÇ

OktaÁ§æ„Çà„ÇäAD/LDAP DelAuth„É¢„Ç∏„É•„Éº„É´„Å´Èñ¢„Åô„ÇãËÑÜÂº±ÊÄß„ÅåÂ†±Âëä„Åï„Çå„Å¶„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åô„Å≠„ÄÇ


https://trust.okta.com/security-advisories/okta-ad-ldap-delegated-authentication-username/

Â†±Âëä„Åï„Çå„Å¶„ÅÑ„ÇãÂÜÖÂÆπ„Å®„Åó„Å¶„ÅØ„ÄÅAD/LDAP DelAuth„É¢„Ç∏„É•„Éº„É´„Çí‰Ωø„Å£„Å¶„ÅÑ„ÇãÁí∞Â¢É„Åß„ÄÅÈÅéÂéª„Å´„Ç≠„É£„ÉÉ„Ç∑„É•„É≠„Ç∞„Ç§„É≥„Å´ÊàêÂäü„Åó„Åü„Åì„Å®„ÅÆ„ÅÇ„ÇãÂ†¥Âêà„ÄÅ„É¶„Éº„Ç∂„ÉºÂêç„Åå52ÊñáÂ≠ó‰ª•‰∏ä„Å†„Å®„Éë„Çπ„ÉØ„Éº„Éâ„Å™„ÅóÔºà„Ç≠„É£„ÉÉ„Ç∑„É•„ÅÆ„Åø„ÅßÔºâ„É≠„Ç∞„Ç§„É≥„ÅåÊàêÂäü„Åó„Å¶„Åó„Åæ„ÅÜ„ÄÅ„Å®„ÅÑ„ÅÜË©±„Åß„Åô„ÄÇ

„Åì„Å°„Çâ‰∏äË®ò„ÅÆ„Çµ„Ç§„Éà„Åã„Çâ„ÅÆÂºïÁî®„Åß„Åô„ÄÇ

On October 30, 2024, a vulnerability was internally identified in generating the cache key for AD/LDAP DelAuth. The Bcrypt algorithm was used to generate the cache key where we hash a combined string of userId + username + password. During specific conditions, this could allow users to authenticate by only providing the username with the stored cache key of a previous successful authentication.

Note: A precondition for this vulnerability is that the username must be or exceed 52 characters any time a cache key is generated for the user.

2024Âπ¥10Êúà30Êó•„ÄÅAD/LDAP DelAuth„ÅÆ„Ç≠„É£„ÉÉ„Ç∑„É•„Ç≠„Éº„ÅÆÁîüÊàê„Å´„Åä„ÅÑ„Å¶„ÄÅÂÜÖÈÉ®ÁöÑ„Å´ËÑÜÂº±ÊÄß„ÅåÁ¢∫Ë™ç„Åï„Çå„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇ„Ç≠„É£„ÉÉ„Ç∑„É•„Ç≠„Éº„ÅÆÁîüÊàê„Å´„ÅØ Bcrypt „Ç¢„É´„Ç¥„É™„Ç∫„É†„Åå‰ΩøÁî®„Åï„Çå„ÄÅuserId + username + password „ÇíÁµÑ„ÅøÂêà„Çè„Åõ„ÅüÊñáÂ≠óÂàó„Åå„Éè„ÉÉ„Ç∑„É•Âåñ„Åï„Çå„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇÁâπÂÆö„ÅÆÊù°‰ª∂‰∏ã„Åß„ÅØ„ÄÅ„É¶„Éº„Ç∂„ÉºÂêç„Å®„ÄÅÈÅéÂéª„Å´Ë™çË®º„Å´ÊàêÂäü„Åó„ÅüÈöõ„Å´‰øùÂ≠ò„Åï„Çå„Åü„Ç≠„É£„ÉÉ„Ç∑„É•„Éª„Ç≠„Éº„Å†„Åë„ÇíÊèê‰æõ„Åô„Çã„Åì„Å®„Åß„ÄÅ„É¶„Éº„Ç∂„Éº„ÅåË™çË®º„Åß„Åç„ÇãÂèØËÉΩÊÄß„Åå„ÅÇ„Çä„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ

Ê≥®Ôºö„Åì„ÅÆËÑÜÂº±ÊÄß„ÅÆÂâçÊèêÊù°‰ª∂„Å®„Åó„Å¶„ÄÅ„Ç≠„É£„ÉÉ„Ç∑„É•„Éª„Ç≠„Éº„ÅåÁîüÊàê„Åï„Çå„ÇãÈöõ„Å´„ÅØ„ÄÅ„É¶„Éº„Ç∂„ÉºÂêç„Åå52ÊñáÂ≠ó‰ª•‰∏ä„Åß„Å™„Åë„Çå„Å∞„Å™„Çä„Åæ„Åõ„Çì„ÄÇ


„Åô„Åß„Å´Okta„ÅÆ„Éó„É≠„ÉÄ„ÇØ„Ç∑„Éß„É≥Áí∞Â¢É„Åß„ÅØËß£Ê∂à„Åï„Çå„Å¶„ÅÑ„Çã„Çà„ÅÜ„Åß„Åô„Åå„ÄÅÊú¨„É¢„Ç∏„É•„Éº„É´„ÇíÂà©Áî®„Åó„Å¶„ÅÑ„ÇãÂ†¥ÂêàÔºàÁâπ„Å´ADÈÄ£Êê∫„Çí„Åó„Å¶„ÅÑ„ÇãÂ†¥Âêà„ÅØ„Åª„ÅºÂøÖ„Åö‰Ωø„Å£„Å¶„ÅÑ„Çã„ÅØ„Åö„ÅÆ„É¢„Ç∏„É•„Éº„É´„Å™„ÅÆ„ÅßÔºâ„ÅØ„ÄÅ„É¶„Éº„Ç∂Âêç„Åå52ÊñáÂ≠ó‰ª•‰∏ä„ÅÇ„Çã„É¶„Éº„Ç∂„Åå„ÅÑ„Çã„Åã„Å©„ÅÜ„Åã„ÄÅ‰æµÂÖ•„ÅÆÁóïË∑°„Åå„Å™„ÅÑ„Åã„ÄÅ„Å™„Å©Á¢∫Ë™ç„Åó„Å¶„Åä„ÅÑ„ÅüÊñπ„ÅåËâØ„Åï„Åù„ÅÜ„Åß„Åô„ÄÇ„Çø„Ç§„É†„É©„Ç§„É≥„ÇíË¶ã„Çã„Å®ËÑÜÂº±ÊÄß„ÅÆ„ÅÇ„Çã„É¢„Ç∏„É•„Éº„É´„Åå„É™„É™„Éº„Çπ„Åï„Çå„Åü„ÅÆ„Åå2024/7/23„Åß„ÄÅÁô∫Ë¶ã„Åï„Çå„Å¶ÂØæÂøú„Åï„Çå„Åü„ÅÆ„Åå2024/10/30„Å®„Å™„Å£„Å¶„Åä„ÇäÊ∞ó„Åå‰ªò„Åã„Å™„ÅÑ„Åæ„ÅæÔºì„É∂ÊúàÁµåÈÅé„Åó„Å¶„ÅÑ„Çã„ÅÆ„Åß„ÄÇ
„Åù„ÇÇ„Åù„ÇÇË´ñ„Å®„Åó„Å¶AD/LDAP DelAuth„Å£„Å¶„Å™„Çì„Å†Ôºü„Å£„Å¶‰∫∫„ÇÇ„ÅÑ„Çã„Å®ÊÄù„ÅÜ„ÅÆ„ÅßÁ∞°Âçò„Å´„ÄÇ Ë¶Å„Åô„Çã„Å´„ÄÅ„ÇØ„É©„Ç¶„Éâ‰∏ä„Å´„ÅÇ„ÇãOkta„Å∏„Ç™„É≥„Éó„É¨„ÅÆAD„ÇÑLDAP„ÅÆ„Éë„Çπ„ÉØ„Éº„Éâ„Çí‰Ωø„Å£„Å¶„É≠„Ç∞„Ç§„É≥„Åß„Åç„Çã„Çà„ÅÜ„Å´„Åô„Çã„É¢„Ç∏„É•„Éº„É´„Åß„Åô„ÄÇ
ADÁâà„ÅØ„Åì„Å°„Çâ https://help.okta.com/en-us/content/topics/security/enable_delegated_auth.htm LDAPÁâà„ÅØ„Åì„Å°„Çâ https://help.okta.com/en-us/content/topics/security/security_authentication.htm
„Åñ„Å£„Åè„Çä„Å®„Åó„Åü‰ªïÁµÑ„Åø„Åß„Åô„Åå„ÄÅOkta„Å∏„ÅÆË™çË®ºË¶ÅÊ±Ç„Åå„ÅÇ„Çã„Å®„Ç™„É≥„Éó„É¨„ÅÆAD/LDAP„Å∏Ë™çË®ºË¶ÅÊ±Ç„ÅåË°å„Çè„Çå„ÄÅÊàêÂäü„Åô„Çã„Å®„Éë„Çπ„ÉØ„Éº„Éâ„Éè„ÉÉ„Ç∑„É•„ÅÆ„Ç≠„É£„ÉÉ„Ç∑„É•„ÅåOkta„ÇØ„É©„Ç¶„ÉâÂÅ¥„Å´ÁΩÆ„Åã„Çå„ÄÅ‰ª•Èôç„Ç≠„É£„ÉÉ„Ç∑„É•„ÅåÊúâÂäπ„Å™Èñì„ÅØ„Ç™„É≥„Éó„É¨ÂÅ¥„Å∏„ÅÆÂïè„ÅÑÂêà„Çè„Åõ„Å™„Åó„Å´„ÇØ„É©„Ç¶„ÉâÂÅ¥„Å†„Åë„ÅßË™çË®ºÂá¶ÁêÜ„ÅåË°å„Çè„Çå„Çã„ÄÅ„Å®„ÅÑ„ÅÜÊÑü„Åò„Åß„Åô„ÄÇ
„Åô„Åß„Å´ÂØæÂøú„ÅØÁµÇ„Çè„Å£„Å¶„ÅÑ„Çã„Å®„ÅØË®Ä„Åà„Å™„Åã„Å™„Åã„Å™ËÑÜÂº±ÊÄß„Åß„Åô„Å≠„ÄÇ„ÄÇ„ÄÇ „Åæ„ÅÅ„ÄÅ„É¶„Éº„Ç∂Âêç„Åå52ÊñáÂ≠ó‰ª•‰∏ä„Å£„Å¶Ë®Ä„ÅÜ„ÅÆ„ÇÇ„ÅÇ„Çì„Åæ„Çä„Å™„ÅÑ„Å®„ÅØÊÄù„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åô„Åå„ÄÇ
19:04 • 10 days ago

Simon Willison

Claude Token Counter

Claude Token Counter Anthropic released a token counting API for Claude a few days ago. I built this tool for running prompts, images and PDFs against that API to count the tokens in them. The API is free (albeit rate limited), but you'll still need to provide your own API key in order to use it. Here's the source code. I built this using two sessions with Claude - one to build the initi

Claude Token Counter

Anthropic released a token counting API for Claude a few days ago.

I built this tool for running prompts, images and PDFs against that API to count the tokens in them.

The API is free (albeit rate limited), but you'll still need to provide your own API key in order to use it.

Here's the source code. I built this using two sessions with Claude - one to build the initial tool and a second to add PDF and image support. That second one is a bit of a mess - it turns out if you drop an HTML file onto a Claude conversation it converts it to Markdown for you, but I wanted it to modify the original HTML source.

The API endpoint also allows you to specify a model, but as far as I can tell from running some experiments the token count was the same for Haiku, Opus and Sonnet 3.5.

Tags: anthropic, claude, ai-assisted-programming, tools, generative-ai, ai, llms, claude-artifacts, llm-pricing

18:52 • 10 days ago

Jon Udell

How To Create Software Diagrams With ChatGPT and Claude

Earlier efforts to diagram software with LLM assistance weren‚Äôt fruitful, but this time around things went really well. I ended up with exactly what I needed to explain the architecture of a browser extension, and along the way I learned a lot about a couple of formats ‚Äî Mermaid and Graphviz ‚Äî as well as ‚Ä¶ Continue reading How To Create Software Diagrams With ChatGPT and Claude

Earlier efforts to diagram software with LLM assistance weren‚Äôt fruitful, but this time around things went really well. I ended up with exactly what I needed to explain the architecture of a browser extension, and along the way I learned a lot about a couple of formats ‚Äî Mermaid and Graphviz ‚Äî as well as their tool ecosystems.

Please publish and share more

Please publish and share more üíØ to all of this by Jeff Triplett: Friends, I encourage you to publish more, indirectly meaning you should write more and then share it. [...] You don‚Äôt have to change the world with every post. You might publish a quick thought or two that helps encourage someone else to try something new, listen to a new song, or binge-watch a new series. Jeff shares my o

Please publish and share more

üíØ to all of this by Jeff Triplett:

Friends, I encourage you to publish more, indirectly meaning you should write more and then share it. [...]

You don‚Äôt have to change the world with every post. You might publish a quick thought or two that helps encourage someone else to try something new, listen to a new song, or binge-watch a new series.

Jeff shares my opinion on conclusions: giving myself permission to hit publish even when I haven't wrapped everything up neatly was a huge productivity boost for me:

Our posts are done when you say they are. You do not have to fret about sticking to landing and having a perfect conclusion. Your posts, like this post, are done after we stop writing.

And another üíØ to this footnote:

PS: Write and publish before you write your own static site generator or perfect blogging platform. We have lost billions of good writers to this side quest because they spend all their time working on the platform instead of writing.

Tags: jeff-triplett, blogging

15:17 • 11 days ago

Ben Werdm√ºller

Kamala Is Not Our Savior. But a Trump Win Would Be Catastrophic.

[Versha Sharma in Teen Vogue] This is a remarkable kind-of-sort-of-endorsement from Teen Vogue. "As the head of this publication, dedicated to young readers, I have been closely following younger generations‚Äô collective disbelief at the Biden administration‚Äôs support of the Israeli government during its all-out assault on Gaza, following the brutal terror attack from Hamas l

[Versha Sharma in Teen Vogue]

This is a remarkable kind-of-sort-of-endorsement from Teen Vogue.

"As the head of this publication, dedicated to young readers, I have been closely following younger generations‚Äô collective disbelief at the Biden administration‚Äôs support of the Israeli government during its all-out assault on Gaza, following the brutal terror attack from Hamas last Oct. 7 ‚Äî including the horrific killing of civilians in Gaza, the targeting of journalists and aid workers, and the reports of children being shot in the head.

The Democrats‚Äô policy on Israel has been disastrous. What is also true: Trump would, somehow, be even worse."

I was once in a private meeting of journalism professionals where someone described Teen Vogue's leadership as "some very left-wing women". I'm not sure how, exactly, Teen Vogue came to be such a blazing voice for progressive values, but - contrary, I think, to what that person intended with their remarks - it's been incredibly impressive to see.

This magazine for teenagers makes point after point about our culpability as Americans in human suffering and how that might be affected by the two candidates in play. It's hardly a surprise how that nets out:

"We would be constrained in even expressing dissent in a Trump administration. He has talked about shooting protesters, jailing his opponents and critics, and taking action against media who dare to report honestly on him, including revoking licenses for broadcast news he disagrees with. Teen Vogue itself could be held liable under a Trump administration ‚Äî there is a world where we could face punishment for publishing something like this."

Which is why, Sharma argues, everyone should vote. Only overwhelming numbers will shut this conversation down: in safe states and swing states and deeply red states.

"If you‚Äôve got any anxiety or concern about this election, I urge you to channel that into action. There‚Äôs no more putting it off or tuning it out. This is it."

This magazine for people who are still in the early stages of figuring out who they are in the world doesn't pull any punches. If Teen Vogue is any indication, the kids are alright.

#Democracy

[Link]

14:22 • 11 days ago

@_Nat Zone

VC(Verifiable Credentials, Ê§úË®ºÂèØËÉΩË≥áÊ†ºÊÉÖÂ†±)„Å´Êú™Êù•„ÅØÁÑ°„ÅÑ„ÅÆ„Åã

‰ªä„ÄÅIdentityÊ•≠Áïå„ÅßË©±È°å„Å´„Å™„Å£„Å¶„ÅÑ„Çã„Éñ„É≠„Ç∞Ë®ò‰∫ã„Åå„ÅÇ„Çä„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇSovrin „Éñ„É≠„ÉÉ„ÇØ„ÉÅ„Çß„Éº„É≥‰∏ä„ÅßÂàÜÊï£ID/Verifiable Credentials (VC) „ÅÆ„ÇΩ„É™„É•„Éº„Ç∑„Éß„É≥„ÇíÊèê‰æõ„Åó„Å¶„ÅÑ„ÅüTrinsicÁ§æ„ÅÆÂâµÊ•≠ËÄÖ„Éí„É•„Éº„Ç∫Ê∞è„ÅÆ10Êúà15Êó•„ÅÆ„Éñ„É≠„Ç∞„ÄåWhy Verifiable‚Ä¶

‰ªä„ÄÅIdentityÊ•≠Áïå„ÅßË©±È°å„Å´„Å™„Å£„Å¶„ÅÑ„Çã„Éñ„É≠„Ç∞Ë®ò‰∫ã„Åå„ÅÇ„Çä„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇSovrin „Éñ„É≠„ÉÉ„ÇØ„ÉÅ„Çß„Éº„É≥‰∏ä„ÅßÂàÜÊï£ID/Verifiable Credentials (VC) „ÅÆ„ÇΩ„É™„É•„Éº„Ç∑„Éß„É≥„ÇíÊèê‰æõ„Åó„Å¶„ÅÑ„ÅüTrinsicÁ§æ„ÅÆÂâµÊ•≠ËÄÖ„Éí„É•„Éº„Ç∫Ê∞è„ÅÆ10Êúà15Êó•„ÅÆ„Éñ„É≠„Ç∞„ÄåWhy Verifiable Credentials Aren‚Äôt Widely Adopted & Why Trinsic Pivoted Ôºà„Å™„ÅúVC„ÅåÂ∫É„ÅèÊé°Áî®„Åï„Çå„Å™„ÅÑ„ÅãÔºÜTrinsicÁ§æ„Åå„Éî„Éú„ÉÉ„Éà„Åó„Åü„ÅãÔºâ„Äç„Åß„Åô„ÄÇ„Åñ„Å£„Å®„Åæ„Å®„ÇÅ„Çã„Å®Ê¨°„ÅÆ„Çà„ÅÜ„Å™ÊÑü„Åò„Åß„Åô„ÄÇ

„Å™„ÅúVC„ÅåÂ∫É„ÅèÊé°Áî®„Åï„Çå„Å™„ÅÑ„ÅãÔºÜTrinsicÁ§æ„Åå„Éî„Éú„ÉÉ„Éà„Åó„Åü„Åã Trinsic„ÅÆÊñπÈáùËª¢Êèõ„ÅÆÊ¶ÇË¶Å IIW38„Å´„Å¶„ÄåSSI„ÅØÊ©üËÉΩ„Åó„Å™„Åã„Å£„Åü„ÄÇTrinsic„ÅØÊñπÈáù„ÇíËª¢Êèõ„Åô„Çã„Äç„Å®„ÅÑ„ÅÜ„Çª„ÉÉ„Ç∑„Éß„É≥„ÅÆÁô∫Ë°®„ÄÇ ËÅ¥Ë°Ü„Åã„ÇâÂ•ΩÊÑèÁöÑ„Å™ÂèçÂøú„Åå„ÅÇ„Çä„ÄÅÊãçÊâã„ÇÑÁîüÊîæÈÄÅ„ÅÆË¶ÅË´ã„Åå„ÅÇ„Å£„Åü„ÄÇ Ê•≠Áïå„ÅÆ„Éô„ÉÜ„É©„É≥„Åü„Å°„Å´„Çà„Çã„Çª„ÉÉ„Ç∑„Éß„É≥„ÅÆÈáçË¶ÅÊÄß„ÅÆË™çË≠ò„ÄÇ ‰∏ªË¶Å„Å™ÂâçÊèê ÂâçÊèê#0ÔºöÁÜ±ÁãÇÁöÑ„Å™ÊîØÊåÅ ‚Äì ËëóËÄÖ„ÅØËá™Â∑±‰∏ªÊ®©Âûã„Ç¢„Ç§„Éá„É≥„ÉÜ„Ç£„ÉÜ„Ç£ÔºàSSIÔºâ„ÅÆÁêÜÂøµ„Å´Âºï„ÅçÁ∂ö„Åç„Ç≥„Éü„ÉÉ„Éà„ÄÇ ÂâçÊèê#1ÔºöÁî®Ë™û ‚Äì Ê§úË®ºÂèØËÉΩ„Å™Ë≥áÊ†ºË®ºÊòéÔºàVCÔºâ„ÇÑËá™Â∑±‰∏ªÊ®©Âûã„Ç¢„Ç§„Éá„É≥„ÉÜ„Ç£„ÉÜ„Ç£ÔºàSSIÔºâ„Å™„Å©„ÅÆÁî®Ë™û„Çí„Åª„ÅºÂêå„Åò„ÇÇ„ÅÆ„Äú„É¶„Éº„Ç∂„Éº„Çª„É≥„Éà„É™„ÉÉ„ÇØ„Å´‰ø°È†º„Åß„Åç„ÇãÂΩ¢„ÅßÂ±ûÊÄß„ÇíËª¢ÈÄÅ„Åô„Çã„Åì„Å®„Åå„Åß„Åç„ÇãÊäÄË°ì„ÅÆÊÑèÂë≥„Åß‰Ωø„Å£„Å¶„ÅÑ„Çã„ÄÇ ÂâçÊèê#2ÔºöÂ∏ÇÂ†¥„ÅÆÁèæÂÆü ‚Äì Â∏ÇÂ†¥„ÅØ‰∫àÊ∏¨‰∏çÂèØËÉΩÔºõÊàêÂäü„Åô„ÇãË£ΩÂìÅ„Å´„ÅØ„Éó„É≠„ÉÄ„ÇØ„Éà/„Éû„Éº„Ç±„ÉÉ„Éà„Éï„Ç£„ÉÉ„Éà„ÅåÂøÖË¶Å„ÄÇ ÂâçÊèê#3ÔºöÊé°Áî®„ÅåÈáçË¶Å ‚Äì ÊúÄÈ´ò„ÅÆÊäÄË°ì„ÅØ„ÄÅ„Åù„ÅÆÊé°Áî®„Å®„É¶„Éº„Ç∂„Éº„Å∏„ÅÆÂΩ±Èüø„Å´„Çà„Å£„Å¶ÂÆöÁæ©„Åï„Çå„Çã„ÄÇ ÂâçÊèê#4ÔºöÊôÇÈñì„ÅÆÁÑ°ÈßÑ„ÇíÈÅø„Åë„Çã ‚Äì „Ç§„Éé„Éô„Éº„Ç∑„Éß„É≥„ÇíÊé®Â•®„Åó„Å§„Å§„ÄÅÂ∏ÇÂ†¥„Åß„ÅÆÊó¢Áü•„ÅÆÂ§±Êïó„Å´ÂØæ„Åó„Å¶Ë≠¶Âëä„ÄÇ Ê≠¥Âè≤ÁöÑËÉåÊôØ 2017Âπ¥„Å´SovrinË≤°Âõ£„Åã„ÇâÂßã„Åæ„Çä„ÄÅ2019Âπ¥„Å´Trinsic„ÅåË®≠Á´ã„ÄÇ ÂΩìÂàù„ÅØÊï∞Áôæ‰∫∫„ÅÆÈñãÁô∫ËÄÖ„ÅåÁôªÈå≤„Åô„ÇãÊàêÂäü„ÇíÂèé„ÇÅ„Çã„ÇÇ„ÄÅÊàêÂäü„Åó„ÅüÈ°ßÂÆ¢‰∫ã‰æã„ÅØ500Á§æ„Å´ÔºëÁ§æ„Å®ÈôêÂÆöÁöÑ„ÄÇ Â∏ÇÂ†¥„Éà„É¨„É≥„Éâ„ÅØÊ§úË®ºÂèØËÉΩ„Å™Ë≥áÊ†ºË®ºÊòé„Çà„Çä„ÇÇÁã¨Ëá™„ÇΩ„É™„É•„Éº„Ç∑„Éß„É≥1„ÇíÂ•Ω„ÇÄÂÇæÂêë„ÇíÁ§∫„Åó„Åü„ÄÇ ÁâπÂÆö„Åï„Çå„ÅüË™≤È°å Áõ∏‰∫íÈÅãÁî®ÊÄß„ÅÆÂïèÈ°å ‚Äì Ê§úË®ºÂèØËÉΩ„Å™Ë≥áÊ†ºË®ºÊòé(VC)Èñì„Åß„ÅÆÁúü„ÅÆÁõ∏‰∫íÈÅãÁî®ÊÄß„ÅÆÊ¨†Â¶ÇÔºõÊ®ôÊ∫ñË¶èÊ†º„ÅåÊôÆÈÅçÁöÑ„Å´ÂêàÊÑè„Åï„Çå„Å¶„ÅÑ„Å™„ÅÑ„ÄÇ „É¶„Éº„Ç∂„Éº‰ΩìÈ®ìÔºàUXÔºâ„ÅÆÊá∏Âøµ ‚Äì VC„ÅÆÂàùÊúü„É¶„Éº„Ç∂„Éº‰ΩìÈ®ì„ÅåÊó¢Â≠ò„ÅÆ„ÇΩ„É™„É•„Éº„Ç∑„Éß„É≥„Çà„ÇäÂä£„Å£„Å¶„Åä„Çä„ÄÅÂ∞éÂÖ•„Å´Ê∂àÊ•µÁöÑ„Å´„Å™„Å£„Å¶„ÅÑ„Çã„ÄÇ ÊôÆÂèä„ÅÆÊï£Âú®Âåñ ‚Äì ÊîØÈÖçÁöÑ„Å™„É¶„Éº„Çπ„Ç±„Éº„Çπ„ÇÑÂú∞ÁêÜÁöÑ„Å™‰∏ÄË≤´ÊÄß„ÅÆÊ¨†Â¶Ç„Å´„Çà„Çä„ÄÅ„Éç„ÉÉ„Éà„ÉØ„Éº„ÇØÂäπÊûú„ÅåÂ¶®„Åí„Çâ„Çå„Å¶„ÅÑ„Çã„ÄÇ Â∞ÜÊù•„ÅÆÂ±ïÊúõ ÊîøÂ∫ú„ÅÆÈñ¢‰∏é ‚Äì ÊîøÂ∫ú„ÅÆË¶ÅË´ã„Å´„Çà„Å£„Å¶VCÊé°Áî®„Åå‰øÉÈÄ≤„Åï„Çå„ÇãÂèØËÉΩÊÄß„ÄÅ„Åü„Å†„Åó„Åì„Çå„ÅØ‰∏≠ÊúüÁöÑ„Å™Ë¶ãÈÄö„Åó„ÄÇ „Çø„Ç§„Éü„É≥„Ç∞„Å®Â∏ÇÂ†¥„ÅÆÊ∫ñÂÇôÁä∂Ê≥Å ‚Äì VC„ÅåÊôÇÊúüÂ∞öÊó©„Å®„ÅÑ„ÅÜË≠∞Ë´ñ„ÅØ„ÄÅÁã¨Ëá™„ÇΩ„É™„É•„Éº„Ç∑„Éß„É≥„ÅÆÊàêÂäü„Å´„Çà„Å£„Å¶Áï∞Ë≠∞„ÇíÂî±„Åà„Çâ„Çå„Å¶„ÅÑ„Çã„ÄÇ Trinsic„ÅÆÊñ∞Êà¶Áï•„ÅØ„ÄÅÊñ∞„Åó„ÅÑ„Éá„Ç∏„Çø„É´ID„ÅÆ‰ΩúÊàê„Åß„ÅØ„Å™„Åè„ÄÅÊó¢Â≠ò„ÅÆ„Éá„Ç∏„Çø„É´ID„ÅÆÂèó„ÅëÂÖ•„Çå„Çí‰ºÅÊ•≠„Å´ÊîØÊè¥„Åô„Çã„Åì„Å®„Å´ÁÑ¶ÁÇπ„ÇíÂΩì„Å¶„ÄÅIDÁí∞Â¢É„ÅÆÊñ≠ÁâáÂåñ„ÅÆÁ∂ôÁ∂ö„ÇíË¶ãËæº„Çì„Åß„ÅÑ„Çã„ÄÇ Dick HardtÊ∞è„ÅÆË¶ãËß£

„Åì„ÅÆË®ò‰∫ã„Å´„ÅØÂ•ΩÊÑèÁöÑ„Å™ÊÑèË¶ã„ÅåÂ§ö„ÅÑ„ÇÇ„ÅÆ„ÅÆ„ÄÅË™≤È°åÂá∫„Åó„Å®„Åó„Å¶„ÅØ‰∏çÂçÅÂàÜ„Å®„ÅÆÂ£∞„ÇÇ„ÅÇ„Çä„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ„Åü„Å®„Åà„Å∞„ÄÅDick Hardt Ê∞è„ÅÆ„Åì„ÅÆLinkedIn„ÅÆ„Éù„Çπ„Éà„Å™„Å©„ÄÇÂêå„Éù„Çπ„Éà„Åß„ÅØ‰ª•‰∏ã„ÅÆ„Çà„ÅÜ„Å™„Åì„Å®„ÇíÊåáÊëò„Åó„Å¶„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ

SSI„Å®Ê§úË®ºÂèØËÉΩ„Å™Ë≥áÊ†ºË®ºÊòéÔºàVCÔºâ„ÄÅÂàÜÊï£Âûã„Ç¢„Ç§„Éá„É≥„ÉÜ„Ç£„ÉÜ„Ç£„ÅåÊ∑∑Âêå„Åï„Çå„Å¶„Åó„Åæ„Å£„Åü„ÅÆ„ÅØÊÆãÂøµ„ÄÇSSI„ÅÆÊú¨Ë≥™„ÅØ„É¶„Éº„Ç∂„Éº„Å´„Ç¢„Ç§„Éá„É≥„ÉÜ„Ç£„ÉÜ„Ç£„ÅÆÂà∂Âæ°„Çí‰∏é„Åà„Çã„Åì„Å®„Å†„Åå„ÄÅÊäÄË°ì„Çπ„Çø„ÉÉ„ÇØ„Å´„Åì„Å†„Çè„Çä„Åô„Åé„Å¶„ÅÑ„Çã„ÄÇ „Ç¢„Éû„Çæ„É≥„Çí5Âπ¥Ââç„Å´ÈÄÄËÅ∑„Åó„Åü„Å®„Åç„ÄÅÂÄã‰∫∫„ÅÆ„Éá„Ç∏„Çø„É´„Ç¢„Ç§„Éá„É≥„ÉÜ„Ç£„ÉÜ„Ç£„ÅÆÁä∂Ê≥Å„ÇíË™øÊüª„Åó„Åü„Åå„ÄÅ„Åù„ÅÆÊôÇÂàÜÊï£Âûã„Ç¢„Ç§„Éá„É≥„ÉÜ„Ç£„ÉÜ„Ç£„ÅØ„Åô„Åß„Å´„Åã„Å™„Çä„ÅÆÊúüÈñìÂ≠òÂú®„Åó„Å¶„ÅÑ„Åü„ÇÇ„ÅÆ„ÅÆ„ÄÅOpenID 2.0„ÇÑOAuth 2.0„ÄÅOpenID Connect (OIDC) „ÅÆ„Çà„ÅÜ„Å™ÊÄ•ÈÄü„Å™ÊôÆÂèä„ÅØË¶ãËæº„ÇÅ„Å™„ÅÑ„Å®ÊÑü„Åò„Åü„ÄÇ„Åù„ÅÆÁêÜÁî±„ÅØ„ÄÅOAuth 1.0„Å®ÂêåÊßò„ÅÆÂïèÈ°å‚ÄîË§áÈõë„ÅßÊó¢Â≠ò„ÅÆ„Éë„Çø„Éº„É≥„ÇíÊ¥ªÁî®„Åó„Å¶„ÅÑ„Å™„ÅÑ‚Äî„ÇíÊä±„Åà„Å¶„ÅÑ„Åü„Åü„ÇÅ„ÄÇ VC„ÅÆ‰∏ª„Å™ÊäÄË°ìÁöÑ„Å™ÂïèÈ°åÁÇπÔºö ÊöóÂè∑Èçµ„ÅÆÁÆ°ÁêÜ„Åå„É¶„Éº„Ç∂„Éº„Å´Ê±Ç„ÇÅ„Çâ„Çå„ÄÅUX„ÅÆË™≤È°å„ÇÑÁ´ØÊú´ÁßªË°å„ÅÆÈöúÂ£Å„Å®„Å™„Å£„Å¶„ÅÑ„Çã Áô∫Ë°åËÄÖ„ÅÆÊÉÖÂ†±„ÅåÈñãÁ§∫„Åï„Çå„ÇãÔºà‰æãÔºöÂπ¥ÈΩ¢Á¢∫Ë™çÊôÇ„Å´Â±Ö‰ΩèÂú∞„Åæ„Åß„Çè„Åã„Å£„Å¶„Åó„Åæ„ÅÜÔºâ Èçµ„ÅÆÂÜçÂà©Áî®„Å´„Çà„Çä„É¶„Éº„Ç∂„Éº„ÅÆË°åÂãï„ÅåËøΩË∑°ÂèØËÉΩ„ÄÇ„Åì„Çå„ÇíÈò≤„Åê„Åü„ÇÅ„Å´„Éê„ÉÉ„ÉÅÁô∫Ë°å„Å™„Å©„ÇíÊ®°Á¥¢„Åó„Å¶„ÅÑ„Çã„Åå„Çâ„Å™„Åä„Åï„ÇâÂÆüË£Ö„ÇÇÈÅãÁî®„ÇÇÈù¢ÂÄí„Å´„Å™„Å£„Å¶„ÅÑ„Çã ÊúÄÂ§ß„ÅÆË™≤È°å„ÅØ„Éì„Ç∏„Éç„Çπ„É¢„Éá„É´Ôºö „É¶„Éº„Ç∂„Éº„ÅØ„Ç¶„Ç©„É¨„ÉÉ„Éà„Å´ÊîØÊâï„Çè„Å™„ÅÑ Áô∫Ë°åËÄÖ„ÅØ„Ç§„É≥„Éï„É©ÊäïË≥á„Åô„Çã„Åå„ÄÅ‰æ°ÂÄ§„ÇíÂæó„Çã„ÅÆ„ÅØÊ§úË®ºËÄÖ Êó¢Â≠ò„ÅÆÂÄã‰∫∫ÊÉÖÂ†±Ë≤©Â£≤„Éì„Ç∏„Éç„Çπ„ÅåVC„Å´ÁßªË°å„Åô„ÇãÂãïÊ©ü„Åå‰∏çË∂≥ „Éê„ÉÉ„ÇØ„Ç®„É≥„Éâ„Åß„ÅÆÊÉÖÂ†±ÁßªÂãï„ÅÆÂèØË¶ñÊÄß„ÅåÁ¢∫‰øù„Åß„Åç„Å™„ÅÑ

Ê¶Ç„Å≠„Çè„Åü„Åó„ÅÆÊÑèË¶ã„Å®Âêå„Åò„Åß„ÄÅ„Å™„Çì„Å™„Çâ„Éí„É•„Éº„Ç∫Ê∞è„ÅÆË®ò‰∫ã„Å´Âá∫„Å¶„Åè„Çã„ÄÅÊïÖ„É¥„Ç£„ÉÉ„Éà„É™„Ç™„Éª„Éô„É´„Éà„ÉÉ„ÉÅÊ∞è„ÅÆË¶ãÊñπ„ÇÇÂêå„Åò„Å†„Å£„Åü„Å®ÊÄù„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ

„Åß„ÅØ„Äå„Å©„Çì„Å™Áã¨Ëá™Ë¶èÊ†º„Äç„Åå‰Ωø„Çè„Çå„Åü„ÅÆ„ÅãÔºü

„Åæ„Åü„ÄÅ„Éí„É•„Éº„Ç∫Ê∞è„ÅÆË®ò‰∫ã„ÅßËß£„Åõ„Å™„ÅÑ„ÅÆ„ÅØ„ÄÅ„Å™„Åú OpenID Connect„ÅåÂá∫„Å¶„Åì„Å™„ÅÑ„ÅÆ„Åã„Åß„Åô„ÄÇÁã¨Ëá™Ë¶èÊ†º„ÇíÊé°Áî®„Åó„Å¶ÊàêÈï∑„Åó„Åü„Å®„Åï„Çå„Çãitsme, YOTI, ID.me, PLAID „ÅØ„ÄÅÂÆüÈöõ„Å´„ÅØOpenID Connect„Çí‰Ωø„Å£„Å¶„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇÁã¨Ëá™Ë¶èÊ†º„Åß„ÅØÁÑ°„ÅÑ„Åß„Åô„Å≠„ÄÇ

„Åæ„Åü„ÄÅChatGPT„Å´‰ª£Ë°®„Åï„Çå„ÇãAI„ÇÇVC„Çí‰Ωø„Çè„Åö„Å´OAuth„Å´Ë°å„Å£„Åü„Å®„ÇÇÊõ∏„Åã„Çå„Å¶„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åô„Åå„ÄÅ„Åì„Çå„Çâ„ÇÇ OpenID Connect „Åß„Åô„ÄÇ„Éí„É•„Éº„Ç∫Ê∞è„ÅåË®Ä„ÅÜ„Çà„ÅÜ„Å´„ÄÅÂ∏ÇÂ†¥„ÅÆÁèæÂÆü„ÄÅÊé°Áî®„ÅåÈáçË¶Å„Å®„ÅÑ„ÅÜ„Åì„Å®„Å´Èëë„Åø„Çå„Å∞OpenID Connect „ÅØ„Åì„Çå„Çâ„ÅÆ„É¶„Éº„Çπ„Ç±„Éº„Çπ„Åß„ÅØ„Çà„ÇäÂÑ™ÁßÄ„Å™ÊäÄË°ì„Å†„Å£„Åü„Å®„ÅÑ„ÅÜ„Åì„Å®„Å´„Å™„Çä„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ

„Åß„ÅØVC„Å´Êú™Êù•„ÅØÁÑ°„ÅÑ„ÅÆ„ÅãÔºü

„Åß„ÅØ„ÄÅVC„Å´Êú™Êù•„ÅØÁÑ°„ÅÑ„ÅÆ„Åß„Åó„Çá„ÅÜ„ÅãÔºü„Çè„Åü„Åó„ÅØ„Éí„É•„Éº„Ç∫Ê∞è„Åª„Å©ÊÇ≤Ë¶≥ÁöÑ„Åß„ÅØ„ÅÇ„Çä„Åæ„Åõ„Çì„ÄÇ„Åó„Åã„Åó„ÄÅÂΩº„ÅÆË®Ä„ÅÜÊôÆÂèä„ÅÆÊï£Âú®Âåñ „ÅØÂïèÈ°å„Å†„Å®ÊÄù„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇOpenID Connect „ÅØ„ÄÅÁô∫Ë°åËÄÖ„ÇÇÁ´ØÊú´„ÇÇ„Ç™„É≥„É©„Ç§„É≥„ÅÆ„Ç±„Éº„Çπ„ÅÆ„Åø„ÇíÊâ±„ÅÜ„Åì„Å®„Å´„Çà„Å£„Å¶ÊäÄË°ì„Çπ„Çø„ÉÉ„ÇØ„Å®ÈÅãÁî®„ÇíÂçòÁ¥îÂåñ„Åó„Å¶„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇÂêåÊßò„ÅÆ„ÄÅ„Åó„Åã„ÅóÈÅï„ÅÜÈÉ®ÂàÜ„Å∏„ÅÆÈõÜ‰∏≠„Å®Ââ≤„ÇäÂàá„Çä„ÅåÂøÖË¶Å„Å™„ÅÆ„Åß„ÅØ„Å™„ÅÑ„Åß„Åó„Çá„ÅÜ„Åã„ÄÇOIDC„ÅÆÊñπ„ÅåÂÑ™„Çå„Å¶„ÅÑ„Çã„Å®„Çè„Åã„Å£„Åü„É¶„Éº„Çπ„Ç±„Éº„Çπ‰ª•Â§ñ„ÅÆ„Å®„Åì„Çç„Å´ÈõÜ‰∏≠„Åô„Çã„Å®„ÅÑ„ÅÜ„Åì„Å®„Åß„Åô„ÄÇ‰ªä„ÅÆVC„ÅØ‰Ωï„Åß„ÇÇËß£„Åì„ÅÜ„Å®„ÅóÈÅé„Åé„Åß„Åô„ÄÇÁ∑öË∑Ø„ÅÆ‰∏ä„ÇÇËµ∞„Çå„ÇãÊ∞¥Èô∏‰∏°Áî®Ëá™ÂãïËªä„Çí‰Ωú„Çç„ÅÜ„Å®„Åó„Å¶„ÅÑ„Çã„Çà„ÅÜ„Å™„ÇÇ„ÅÆ„Åß„Åô„ÄÇ

ÔºàÂõ≥Ë°®1Ôºâ„É¨„Éº„É´„ÅÆ‰∏ä„ÇÇËµ∞„Çå„ÇãÊ∞¥Èô∏‰∏°Áî®Ëá™ÂãïËªä

„Çè„Åü„Åó„ÅåVC„Å´Èï∑Âπ¥Ê±Ç„ÇÅ„Å¶„ÅÑ„Çã„ÅÆ„ÅØ

Áô∫Ë°åËÄÖ„Åå„Ç™„Éï„É©„Ç§„É≥„Å´„Å™„Å£„Å¶„ÇÇÂ≠òÂú®„Åó„Å™„Åè„Å™„Å£„Å¶„ÇÇ‰Ωø„ÅÑÁ∂ö„Åë„Çã„Åì„Å®„Åå„Åß„Åç„Çã Á´ØÊú´„Åå„Ç™„Éï„É©„Ç§„É≥„Åß„ÇÇ‰Ωø„ÅÑÁ∂ö„Åë„Çã„Åì„Å®„ÅåÂá∫Êù•„Çã „É¶„Éº„Ç∂„Éº„Åå„Å©„ÅÆ„Ç¶„Ç©„É¨„ÉÉ„Éà„Çí‰Ωø„ÅÜ„Åπ„Åç„Åã„ÅßÊÉë„Çè„Åï„Çå„Å™„ÅÑ ÂÖ¨ÁöÑË≥áÈáë„ÅßË£úÂä©„Åï„Çå„Å™„ÅÑÂ†¥Âêà„Å´„ÅØÁô∫Ë°åËÄÖ„Å´Ê§úË®ºËÄÖ„Åã„ÇâÂà©Áõä„ÅåÈÇÑÂÖÉ„Åô„Çã

„Å®„ÅÑ„ÅÜË¶Å‰ª∂„ÇíÊ∫Ä„Åü„Åô„É¶„Éº„Çπ„Ç±„Éº„Çπ„Å´ÈõÜ‰∏≠„Åó„Å¶ÊäÄË°ì„Çπ„Çø„ÉÉ„ÇØ„Å®„Ç®„Ç≥„Ç∑„Çπ„ÉÜ„É†„ÇíÁ¢∫Á´ã„Åô„Çã„Åì„Å®„Åß„Åô„ÄÇ

Âä†„Åà„Å¶

Áô∫Ë°åËÄÖÊÉÖÂ†±„ÅØ„Ç∞„É´„Éº„ÉóÊÉÖÂ†±„Å®„Åó„Å¶„Åó„ÅãÈñãÁ§∫„Åï„Çå„Å™„ÅÑ

„Çà„ÅÜ„Å´„Å™„Çå„Å∞„Å™„ÅäËâØ„ÅÑ„Åß„Åô„ÄÇ„Åì„Çå„ÅØÁô∫Ë°åËÄÖÂÅ¥„Åå„Ç∞„É´„Éº„ÉóÁΩ≤Âêç„Çí‰Ωø„ÅÜ„Çà„ÅÜ„Å´„Å™„Çå„Å∞Ëß£„Åë„ÇãÂïèÈ°å„Åß„Åô„Åã„Å≠Ôºû‰ΩêÂè§Á†îÁ©∂ÂÆ§„ÅÆ„Åø„Å™„Åï„Çì„ÄÇ

ÂÖà„Åö„ÅØ„Åì„ÅÆËæ∫„Å´ÈõÜ‰∏≠„Åô„Çå„Å∞ÂãùÊ©ü„ÇÇË¶ã„Åà„Å¶„Åè„Çã„ÅÆ„Åß„ÅØÁÑ°„ÅÑ„Åß„Åó„Çá„ÅÜ„Åã„ÄÇ

„ÅÇ„Å®„Å≠„ÄÅ‰ª•Ââç„Åã„ÇâÊåáÊëò„Åó„Å¶„ÅÑ„Çã„Çà„ÅÜ„Å´„ÄÅ„ÇØ„Ç®„É™„É©„É≥„Ç≤„Éº„Ç∏„Å®„Åã„ÅØÂäáÁöÑ„Å´ÂçòÁ¥îÂåñ„Åó„Å™„ÅÑ„Å®ÈßÑÁõÆ„Å†„ÄÇPresentation Exchange „Å®„ÅãË§áÈõë„Åô„Åé„Çã„ÄÇOpenID „ÅÆclaims syntax „Åß„Åô„ÇâË§áÈõë„ÅßÊôÆÂèä„Åó„Å™„Åã„Å£„Åü„Çì„Åß„Åô„Åú„ÄÇDCQL„Åß„ÇÇË§áÈõë„Åô„Åé„Çã„Å®ÊÄù„ÅÜ„ÄÇDCQL„ÅÆÂçòÁ¥îÂåñ„Åó„ÅüÈÉ®ÂàÜ„Å†„ÅëÔºà„Åì„Çå„Åß„Çà„ÅÜ„ÇÑ„ÅèClaims SyntaxÁõ∏ÂΩì„ÅÆË§áÈõë„ÅïÔºâ„ÅßÊúÄÂàù„ÅØÂçÅÂàÜ„ÄÇ

„Åæ„Å†„ÅÑ„Çç„ÅÑ„ÇçË®Ä„ÅÑ„Åü„ÅÑ„Åì„Å®„ÇÇ„ÅÇ„Çä„Åæ„Åô„Åå„ÄÅ‰ªäÊó•„ÅÆ„Å®„Åì„Çç„ÅØ„Åì„ÅÆËæ∫„Å´„Åó„Å¶„Åä„Åç„Åæ„Åó„Çá„ÅÜ„ÄÇ

„ÅÇ„ÄÅ„Åù„ÅÜ„Åù„ÅÜ„ÄÅTrinsicÁ§æ„Åå„ÅÑ„Å™„Åè„Å™„Å£„Åü„Åì„Å®„Å®Èñ¢‰øÇ„ÅÇ„Çã„Åã„Çè„Åã„Çä„Åæ„Åõ„Çì„Åå„ÄÅSovrin „Éñ„É≠„ÉÉ„ÇØ„ÉÅ„Çß„Éº„É≥„ÇÇÊ≠¢„Åæ„Çã„Åì„Å®„ÅåÊ±∫ÂÆö„Åó„Å¶„Åó„Åæ„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åó„Åü„Å≠„ÄÇ„Éñ„É≠„ÉÉ„ÇØ„ÉÅ„Çß„Éº„É≥„ÅåÊ∞∏Á∂öÊÄß„ÇíÊãÖ‰øù„Åó„Å™„ÅÑËâØ„ÅÑ‰æã„Å´„Å™„Çä„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇ

„Åù„Çå„Åß„ÅØ„Åæ„ÅüÔºÅ

13:00 • 11 days ago

IdM Laboratory

OpenID for Verifiable Presnetations„ÅÆÊñ∞„Åó„ÅÑImplementer's draft„ÅÆPublic Review„ÅåÂßã„Åæ„Çä„Åæ„Åó„Åü

„Åì„Çì„Å´„Å°„ÅØ„ÄÅÂØåÂ£´Ê¶Æ„Åß„Åô„ÄÇ IIW„ÇÑ„ÄÅ„Åù„ÅÆÂâçÊó•„ÅÆOpenID Foundation Workshop„Åß„ÇÇÂèñ„Çä‰∏ä„Åí„Çâ„Çå„Å¶„ÅÑ„Åü„Å®„Åä„Çä„ÄÅOpenID for Verifiable Presentations„ÅÆÊñ∞„Åü„Å™Implementer's draft„ÅÆPublic ReviewÊúüÈñì„Å´ÂÖ•„Çä„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇ „Ç¢„Éä„Ç¶„É≥„Çπ https://openid.net/public-review-period-for-proposed-third-implementers-draft-of-openid-for-verifiable-presentations-specification-3/ ‰∏ª„Å™Êõ¥Êñ∞„ÅØ„Åì„Å°„Çâ Introduces the Digital Credentials Query Language; this is an alternative to Presentation

„Åì„Çì„Å´„Å°„ÅØ„ÄÅÂØåÂ£´Ê¶Æ„Åß„Åô„ÄÇ

IIW„ÇÑ„ÄÅ„Åù„ÅÆÂâçÊó•„ÅÆOpenID Foundation Workshop„Åß„ÇÇÂèñ„Çä‰∏ä„Åí„Çâ„Çå„Å¶„ÅÑ„Åü„Å®„Åä„Çä„ÄÅOpenID for Verifiable Presentations„ÅÆÊñ∞„Åü„Å™Implementer's draft„ÅÆPublic ReviewÊúüÈñì„Å´ÂÖ•„Çä„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇ



„Ç¢„Éä„Ç¶„É≥„Çπ

https://openid.net/public-review-period-for-proposed-third-implementers-draft-of-openid-for-verifiable-presentations-specification-3/


‰∏ª„Å™Êõ¥Êñ∞„ÅØ„Åì„Å°„Çâ

Introduces the Digital Credentials Query Language; this is an alternative to Presentation Exchange Introduces the transaction data mechanism that enables a binding between the user's identification/authentication and the user‚Äôs authorization, for example to complete a payment transaction, or to sign specific document(s) using QES (Qualified Electronic Signatures). Removes the client_id_scheme parameter and instead makes the client id scheme a prefix on the client_id; this addresses a security issue with the previous solution.

„Éá„Ç∏„Çø„É´„Éª„ÇØ„É¨„Éá„É≥„Ç∑„É£„É´„Éª„ÇØ„Ç®„É™„Éª„É©„É≥„Ç≤„Éº„Ç∏ÔºàDigital Credentials Query LanguageÔºâ„ÇíÂ∞éÂÖ•„ÄÇ „Éà„É©„É≥„Ç∂„ÇØ„Ç∑„Éß„É≥„Éª„Éá„Éº„Çø„Éª„É°„Ç´„Éã„Ç∫„É†„ÇíÂ∞éÂÖ•„Åó„ÄÅ„É¶„Éº„Ç∂„ÅÆË≠òÂà•/Ë™çË®º„Å®„É¶„Éº„Ç∂„ÅÆË™çÂèØ„ÅÆÈñì„ÅÆ„Éê„Ç§„É≥„Éá„Ç£„É≥„Ç∞„ÇíÂèØËÉΩ„Å´„Åô„ÇãÔºà‰æã„Åà„Å∞„ÄÅÊîØÊâï„ÅÑ„Éà„É©„É≥„Ç∂„ÇØ„Ç∑„Éß„É≥„ÅÆÂÆå‰∫Ü„ÇÑ„ÄÅQESÔºàQualified Electronic SignaturesÔºâ„Çí‰ΩøÁî®„Åó„ÅüÁâπÂÆö„ÅÆÊñáÊõ∏„Å∏„ÅÆÁΩ≤Âêç„Å™„Å©Ôºâ„ÄÇ client_id_scheme„Éë„É©„É°„Éº„Çø„ÇíÂâäÈô§„Åó„ÄÅ‰ª£„Çè„Çä„Å´„ÇØ„É©„Ç§„Ç¢„É≥„ÉàID„Çπ„Ç≠„Éº„É†„Çíclient_id„ÅÆ„Éó„É¨„Éï„Ç£„ÉÉ„ÇØ„Çπ„Å®„Åô„Çã„ÄÇ


‰ªäÂæå„ÅÆ„Çπ„Ç±„Ç∏„É•„Éº„É´„ÅØ„Åì„Å°„Çâ

Implementer's Draft public review period: Friday, November 1, 2024 to Sunday, December 16, 2024 (45 days) Implementer's Draft vote announcement: Tuesday, December 3, 2024 Implementer's Draft early voting opens: Tuesday, December 10, 2024 Implementer's Draft official voting period: Tuesday, December 17 to Tuesday, December 24, 2024
Âπ¥ÂÜÖ„Å´ÊâøË™ç„Åï„Çå„Åù„ÅÜ„Åß„Åô„Å≠„ÄÇÂÆüË£Ö‰∏≠„ÅÆÁöÜ„Åï„Çì„ÅØÂØæÂøúÊñπÈáù„ÇíËÄÉ„Åà„Å¶„Åä„Åç„Åæ„Åó„Çá„ÅÜ„ÄÇ
06:30 • 11 days ago

Simon Willison

SmolLM2

SmolLM2 New from Loubna Ben Allal and her research team at Hugging Face: SmolLM2 is a family of compact language models available in three size: 135M, 360M, and 1.7B parameters. They are capable of solving a wide range of tasks while being lightweight enough to run on-device. [...] It was trained on 11 trillion tokens using a diverse dataset combination: FineWeb-Edu, DCLM, The Stack, along

SmolLM2

New from Loubna Ben Allal and her research team at Hugging Face:

SmolLM2 is a family of compact language models available in three size: 135M, 360M, and 1.7B parameters. They are capable of solving a wide range of tasks while being lightweight enough to run on-device. [...]

It was trained on 11 trillion tokens using a diverse dataset combination: FineWeb-Edu, DCLM, The Stack, along with new mathematics and coding datasets that we curated and will release soon.

The model weights are released under an Apache 2 license. I've been trying these out using my llm-gguf plugin for LLM and my first impressions are really positive.

Here's a recipe to run a 1.7GB Q8 quantized model from lmstudio-community:

llm install llm-gguf llm gguf download-model https://huggingface.co/lmstudio-community/SmolLM2-1.7B-Instruct-GGUF/resolve/main/SmolLM2-1.7B-Instruct-Q8_0.gguf -a smol17 llm chat -m smol17

Or at the other end of the scale, here's how to run the 138MB Q8 quantized 135M model:

llm gguf download-model https://huggingface.co/lmstudio-community/SmolLM2-135M-Instruct-GGUF/resolve/main/SmolLM2-135M-Instruct-Q8_0.gguf' -a smol135m llm chat -m smol135m

The blog entry to accompany SmolLM2 should be coming soon, but in the meantime here's the entry from July introducing the first version: SmolLM - blazingly fast and remarkably powerful .

Via @LoubnaBenAllal1

Tags: llm, hugging-face, generative-ai, ai, llms, open-source, edge-llms

05:27 • 11 days ago

@_Nat Zone

SD-JWT VC over proximity/offline

Ë™≤È°åÊÑüÔºö„Ç¶„Ç©„É¨„ÉÉ„Éà„Åå„Ç™„Éï„É©„Ç§„É≥„ÅÆÂ†¥Âêà„ÅÆSD-JWT VCÊèêÁ§∫ÊñπÊ≥ï„Åå„Å™„ÅÑ„ÄÇ

„Ç™„Éó„Ç∑„Éß„É≥„Å®„Åó„Å¶„ÅÇ„Çä„Åù„ÅÜ„Å™„ÅÆ„Åå‰ª•‰∏ã„ÅÆ„Çà„ÅÜ„Å™ÊÑü„Åò„ÄÇ

„Å™„Å©„ÅåÂèñ„Çä‰∏ä„Åí„Çâ„Çå„Å¶„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇ

(9-A) RPË™çË®º„Å®Ë™çÂèØ (EUDIW) (Torsten Lodderstedt, Giuseppe Di Marco)

RP Authentication & Authorization

„Å™„ÅúRPÔºàRelying PartyÔºö‰æùÊã†ÂΩì‰∫ãËÄÖÔºâ„ÅÆË™çË®º„ÅåÈáçË¶Å„Å™„ÅÆ„Åã

„Éá„Ç∏„Çø„É´ID„Ç∑„Çπ„ÉÜ„É†„Å´„Åä„ÅÑ„Å¶„ÄÅRP„Å®„ÅÆÂÆâÂÖ®„Å™Èñ¢‰øÇ„ÇíÁ¢∫Á´ã„Åô„Çã„Åì„Å®„ÅØ‰ª•‰∏ã„ÅÆÁêÜÁî±„Åß‰∏çÂèØÊ¨†„Åß„ÅôÔºö

Ê≥ïÁöÑ„Å™ÈÄèÊòéÊÄß„ÅÆÁ¢∫‰øùÔºàÊ≥ïÂæã„ÅßÁæ©Âãô‰ªò„ÅëÔºâ ÂøÖË¶Å„Å´Âøú„Åò„ÅüÈÄö‰ø°„ÇÑÊ≥ïÁöÑÊâãÁ∂ö„Åç„ÅÆÂÆüÊñΩ „Éá„Éº„ÇøË¶ÅÊ±Ç„ÅÆÁØÑÂõ≤„ÅåÈÅ©Âàá„Åã„Å©„ÅÜ„Åã„ÅÆÁ¢∫Ë™ç Ë™çË®º„Å®Ë™çÂèØ„ÅÆ‰ªïÁµÑ„Åø PIDÔºàÂÄã‰∫∫Ë≠òÂà•„Éá„Éº„ÇøÔºâ„Å®EAAÔºàÈõªÂ≠êÂ±ûÊÄßË®ºÊòéÔºâ„ÅÆÂèñ„ÇäÊâ±„ÅÑ „Éó„É≠„Éê„Ç§„ÉÄ„Éº„ÅØÈñãÁ§∫„Éù„É™„Ç∑„Éº„ÇíÈÄö„Åò„Å¶„Éá„Éº„Çø„Ç¢„ÇØ„Çª„Çπ„ÇíÁÆ°ÁêÜ „Éù„É™„Ç∑„Éº„ÅØRP„ÅÆÂΩπÂâ≤„ÇÑÊ®©ÈôêË®ºÊòé„Å®‰∏ÄËá¥„Åô„ÇãÂøÖË¶Å„Åå„ÅÇ„Çã „É¶„Éº„Ç∂„Éº„ÅÆ informed decisionÔºàÂçÅÂàÜ„Å™ÊÉÖÂ†±„Å´Âü∫„Å•„ÅèÊ±∫ÂÆöÔºâ„ÇíÊîØÊè¥ ÂÆüË£Ö„Ç™„Éó„Ç∑„Éß„É≥ X.509Ë®ºÊòéÊõ∏ OpenID Federation SD-JWTÔºàSelective Disclosure JWTÔºâ„Å´„Çà„ÇãË®ºÊòé „Ç§„Çø„É™„Ç¢„ÅÆ‰∫ã‰æãÔºöOpenID Federation„ÅÆÊ¥ªÁî®

„Ç§„Çø„É™„Ç¢„Åß„ÅØ„ÄÅ‰ª•‰∏ã„ÅÆ„Çà„ÅÜ„Å™ÈöéÂ±§ÁöÑ„Å™‰ø°È†º„É¢„Éá„É´„ÇíÊé°Áî®„Åó„Å¶„ÅÑ„Åæ„ÅôÔºö

ÂêÑ‰∫ãÊ•≠‰Ωì„ÅØËá™Ë∫´„ÅÆË®≠ÂÆö„ÇíÂÆ£Ë®Ä „Ç§„Çø„É™„Ç¢ÈÄ£Êê∫‚ÜíEUÈÄ£Êê∫„Å®„ÅÑ„ÅÜÈöéÂ±§ÊßãÈÄ† ‰ø°È†º„ÉÅ„Çß„Éº„É≥„Å´„Çà„Çã„É™„Ç¢„É´„Çø„Ç§„É†„ÅÆ„Éù„É™„Ç∑„ÉºÁÆ°ÁêÜ „Éà„É©„Çπ„Éà„Éû„Éº„ÇØÔºà‰ø°È†º„ÅÆÂç∞Ôºâ„Å´„Çà„ÇãË™çË®º ÁâπÂæ¥ÁöÑ„Å™ÁÇπ „Ç®„É≥„ÉÜ„Ç£„ÉÜ„Ç£ID„Å´„Çà„Çã‰ø°È†ºÊÄß„ÅÆÁ¢∫Ë™ç DCQL„Å´„Çà„Çã„ÇØ„Ç®„É™Ë®ÄË™û„ÅÆÊ®ôÊ∫ñÂåñ Á¨¨‰∏âËÄÖ„Å´„Çà„Çã‰ø°È†ºÊÄß„ÅÆ‰ªò‰∏é ËÄÉÊÖÆ„Åô„Åπ„ÅçË™≤È°å

Áâπ„Å´Ê≥®ÁõÆ„Åô„Åπ„ÅçÁÇπ„Å®„Åó„Å¶„ÄÅ„Åô„Åπ„Å¶„ÅÆRP„ÅåÊ≥ï‰∫∫Ê†º„ÇíÊåÅ„Å§„Å®„ÅØÈôê„Çâ„Å™„ÅÑ„Å®„ÅÑ„ÅÜÁèæÂÆü„Åå„ÅÇ„Çä„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ‰æã„Åà„Å∞Ôºö

ÂõΩÈöõÁöÑ„Å™Á†îÁ©∂ÂçîÂäõ„Éó„É≠„Ç∏„Çß„ÇØ„Éà Ë§áÊï∞„ÅÆÂè∏Ê≥ïÁÆ°ËΩÑÂå∫Âüü„Å´„Åæ„Åü„Åå„ÇãÁµÑÁπî „Åù„ÅÆ‰ªñ

„Åù„ÅÆ‰ªñ„ÇÇ„Å°„Çç„Çì„Çµ„Ç§„Éâ„Éü„Éº„ÉÜ„Ç£„É≥„Ç∞„ÇÇ„ÅÇ„Çä„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇ

‰ªä„ÅØÂÖ¨Èñã„Åß„Åç„Å™„ÅÑÁßòÂØÜ„ÅÆË©±ÔºàÊ∞¥ÊõúÊó•Â§úÔºâ EUDIW„ÅÆsubÂÄ§„Å™„Å©„Å´„Å§„ÅÑ„Å¶ÔºàÊú®ÊõúÊó•Ôºâ Anoop Saxana FAPI ÂÖ±ÂêåË≠∞Èï∑„Å®„ÅÆCFPBÂØæÂøú„ÅÆ„Éü„Éº„ÉÜ„Ç£„É≥„Ç∞ÔºàÊú®ÊõúÊó•Â§ïÂàªÔºâ BGIN„Å´„Å§„ÅÑ„Å¶„ÅÆ„Éá„Ç£„Éä„Éº„Éü„Éº„ÉÜ„Ç£„É≥„Ç∞ÔºàÊú®ÊõúÊó•Â§úÔºâ Drummond Reed „Å®„ÅÆGlobal Acceptance Network „Å´„Å§„ÅÑ„Å¶„ÅÆ„Éü„Éº„ÉÜ„Ç£„É≥„Ç∞ÔºàÈáëÊõúÊó•„ÅÆ„Éñ„É¨„ÉÉ„ÇØ„Éï„Ç°„Çπ„Éà„Éü„Éº„ÉÜ„Ç£„É≥„Ç∞Ôºâ Edmund Jay „Å®„ÅÆ„Éü„Éº„ÉÜ„Ç£„É≥„Ç∞ÔºàÈáëÊõúÊó•ÊòºÔºâ „Å™„Å©„Å™„Å©

„Å™„Åä„ÄÅ‰ªäÂõû„ÅÆIIW„ÅÆÊúÄÁµÇÈÄÄÂá∫ËÄÖ„ÅØ„Çè„Åü„Åó„Åß„Åô„ÄÇË®ºÊã†„ÅÆÂÜôÁúü„Åå„Åì„Çå„ÄÇ

Anoop„Å®„É™„É¢„Éº„Éà„Åß‰ºöË≠∞„Åó„Å¶„ÇãÈñì„Å´„Åø„Çì„Å™„Éì„Éº„É´È£≤„Åø„Å´Ë°å„Å£„Å°„ÇÉ„Å£„Åü„Çì„Åß„Åô„ÄÇ
